SEARCH
Package gw.api.policy.refresh.relink

Class BaseLinkHandler<T extends KeyableBean>

java.lang.Object
gw.api.policy.refresh.relink.BaseLinkHandler<T>
All Implemented Interfaces:
LinkHandler<T>
Direct Known Subclasses:
DefaultLinkHandler, IgnoreIfNotMatchedLinkHandler
public abstract class BaseLinkHandler<T extends KeyableBean> extends Object implements LinkHandler<T>
Base implementation of LinkHandler that implements most of the required behavior, leaving the handling of the case where there is no match (in either case) in the new policy to subclass implementations.
Author:
bspies

  • Constructor Details

    • BaseLinkHandler

      public BaseLinkHandler()

  • Method Details

    • relink

      public final void relink(RelinkItem<T> brokenLink, Direction direction, RelinkContext relinkContext)
      Relinks the foreign key by calling the appropriate method according to the link direction.
      Specified by:
      relink in interface LinkHandler<T extends KeyableBean>
      Parameters:
      brokenLink - The link broken between the Claim and Policy (and vice-versa)
      direction - The direction of the broken link
      relinkContext - The policy relinking context

    • handleClaimToPolicyLink

      public void handleClaimToPolicyLink(RelinkItem<T> fkItem, RelinkContext relinkContext)
      Called for relinking a foreign key from the Claim graph to the existing policy graph. Calls handleMatchedLinkTarget() in the case where there is a match for the target in the new policy; otherwise calls handleRemovedLinkTarget(). Generally, you will not want to override this method, but use handleMatchedLinkTarget() and/or handleRemovedLinkTarget() to customize behavior instead.
      Parameters:
      fkItem - The foreign key relink item
      relinkContext - The relinking context

    • handleMatchedLinkTarget

      public void handleMatchedLinkTarget(RelinkItem<T> fkItem, RelinkContext relinkContext, KeyableBean newBean)
      This is used for Claim-to-Policy links only. Called in the case where the relink has a matching target. Generally, you will not want to override this method, as the default behavior is almost always what you want; but there are cases where uniqueness or other datamodel constraints must be checked before relinking, and handled appropriately.
      Parameters:
      fkItem - The relink item
      relinkContext - The relinking context
      newBean - The new target

    • relinkNewTarget

      public void relinkNewTarget(RelinkItem<T> fkItem, KeyableBean newTarget)
      Relinks the relink item to the new target bean.
      Parameters:
      fkItem - The relink item (broken link)
      newTarget - The new target

    • hasDuplicateOnTarget

      public boolean hasDuplicateOnTarget(RelinkItem<T> fkItem, KeyableBean newTarget)
      Would relinking the toBeRelinked bean cause an unique index violation, i.e. does it match any of the existing beans on the appropriate index columns? This method checks any unique indexes to see if the bean to be relinked and any of the existing beans have the same values for the index columns. toBeRelinked bean are the same for the existingBeans
      Parameters:
      fkItem - The relink item
      newTarget - The new target to which the fkItem.Owner will be relinked
      Returns:
      True if the bean to be relinked has the same unique values as any of the existing beans attached to the new target

    • handleRemovedLinkTarget

      public abstract void handleRemovedLinkTarget(RelinkItem<T> fkItem, RelinkContext relinkContext)
      This is used for Claim-to-Policy links only. This method must be overriden to determine how the relink is handled if the target of the link has no match in the new Policy.
      Parameters:
      fkItem - The relink item
      relinkContext - The relink context

    • handlePolicyToClaimLink

      public void handlePolicyToClaimLink(RelinkItem<T> item, RelinkContext context)
      Called for relinking (transferring) a foreign key from a policy graph entity to a claim graph entity. Transfers the link from the owner of the foreign key to the replacement in the new policy if there is a match for the owner in the new Policy. In general, you will not want to override this method, but use handleMatchedLinkSource() and/or handleRemovedLinkSource() instead to customize the relinking behavior for a given Policy-related entity.
      Parameters:
      item - The relink item
      context - The relink context

    • handleMatchedLinkSource

      public void handleMatchedLinkSource(RelinkItem<T> item, T newBean)
      This method is invoked only in the case where a Policy-to-Claim link has a match for its source. The default behavior is to transfer the link from the owner to its replacement in the new Policy, but this may be overridden. Generally, you will not want to override this behavior.
      Parameters:
      item - The relink item
      newBean - The replacement in the new Policy

    • handleRemovedLinkSource

      public void handleRemovedLinkSource(RelinkItem<T> fkItem, RelinkContext relinkContext)
      This method is invoked only in the case where a Policy-to-Claim link has its source removed, i.e., it has no replacement in the new Policy. By default does nothing, as the owner of the FK will simply be removed, but this behavior may be overridden.
      Parameters:
      fkItem - The relink item
      relinkContext - The relink context

    • removeLinkIfAllowed

      public void removeLinkIfAllowed(RelinkItem<T> fkItem)
      Removes the foreign key link if it is nullable. Otherwise throws exception. This is a helper method which can be called from handleRemovedLinkTarget().
      Parameters:
      fkItem - The relink item
      Throws:
      com.guidewire.pl.web.controller.UserDisplayableException - If the FK link is defined as nullok="false"

    • handleDuplicateOnTarget

      public void handleDuplicateOnTarget(RelinkItem<T> fkItem, RelinkContext relinkContext, KeyableBean newBean)
      This method is called in the case where handleMatchedLinkTarget() finds a duplicate linked to the new target.
      Parameters:
      fkItem - The relink item
      relinkContext - The relinking context
      newBean - The new target
